title: Calendar view
description:
For each project, based on the tasks and features that were completed - it must be possible to view a timeline of features when they were done in a scrollable timeline view.
The user must be able to also define their own labels/nodes to the timeline as extra rows - these need to be stored.
It must be also possible to view an overall timeline - that will show all projects and their tasks (rather than features) - so a higher level view.

features.title: Implement Data Model and Storage for User-Defined Timeline Labels
features.description: Define a new data model (entity) for user-defined timeline labels/nodes. This entity should include fields such as `id: string`, `projectId: string | null` (to associate with a specific project or for a global label), `timestamp: Date`, `label: string`, and `description: string | undefined`. Implement the necessary `add`, `get`, `update`, and `delete` operations for these timeline labels using `thefactory-db`'s entity management within the main process (`src/db/DatabaseManager.ts` or a new dedicated service). Expose these operations via IPC handlers so the renderer process can manage them.

features.title: Implement Project-Specific Feature Timeline View
features.description:
Develop the front-end components and backend data fetching logic for a project-specific timeline view. This feature should:
1.  Create new IPC handlers (or extend existing ones) in the main process to fetch all completed `Feature` entities for a given `projectId`, ordered by their `completedAt` timestamp.
2.  Extend the IPC handlers for user-defined timeline labels to fetch labels associated with a specific `projectId` or global labels.
3.  Implement a `timelineService` in `src/renderer/services/` to consolidate calls for completed features and relevant user-defined labels for a project.
4.  Develop a new React UI component (e.g., `ProjectTimelineView.tsx` in `src/renderer/screens/` or `src/renderer/components/`) that consumes the `timelineService` data and displays a scrollable timeline of completed features and user-defined labels.

features.title: Add TimeLineView to the sidebar
features.description: @src/renderer/screens/ProjectTimelineView.tsx should be added to the @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx between LiveData and Notifications.

features.title: ProjectTimelineView shows nothing
features.description:
Currently when accessing the @src/renderer/screens/ProjectTimelineView.tsx from the @src/renderer/navigation/SidebarView.tsx - it displays blank - nothing.
It should show a calendar view that a user can add their labels to and all the features that were completed for this project should be added to it as tiles across the timeline.

features.title: ProjectTimelineView needs a design update
features.description:
The @src/renderer/screens/ProjectTimelineView.tsx doesn't look great.
Take inspiration from Notion's Timeline view as explained here:
https://www.notion.com/help/guides/timeline-view-unlocks-high-output-planning-for-your-team
As well as Airtable's :
https://blog.airtable.com/introducing-airtables-new-timeline-view/

These are two standard looking Timeline views that we want to emulate here.
Mak sure you maintain our design principles and colors as defined in @docs/design/MONDAY_PALETTE_REFERENCE.md , @docs/design/DESIGN_TOKENS.md , @docs/design/DESIGN_SYSTEM.md , @docs/design/COMPONENTS.md , @docs/ux/LINEAR_UX_GUIDELINES.md
